answers.answer: You should speak to your doctor and/ or surgeon about this.Fingers crossed it's not another abscess.  Could you have lymphodema?

See another specialist, change surgeons. Mastitis, or breast infection should get better with resection and antibiotics. Have they sent out pus for analysis? You may have a lingering staff infection and may need different antibiotics. My advice, seek second opinion, see a specialized mamologist and go to another surgeon.

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!Check for diabetes as high sugar often results in repeated infection and boils. Incomplete drainage, a fistula in breast can also be a cause. Please discuss this with the doctor.It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage.  Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: I am in my early forties and have had chronic breast infections for around 4 years now.  The first one went away with antibotics and was good for about a year.  It returned with more pain and discomfort.  At that time I was sent to a infection specialist then a breast surgeon.  In between was mamograms which are horribile with a good breast but even more with an infected one.  I had tissue removed and thought it was going to be ok then around a month later the surgery site errupted with pus.  And so it started again, around every 2 months.  I just would drain it myself and go on with life.  Then May of 2009 I developed what I thought was the flu and went to my primary care and he ask how my breast was doing and I relized it had to do with that I went straight to my breast surgeon and she admitted me to the hospital where I spent 4 days on IV's, ultrasound, and drained again.  I was good until December and it came back.  It would pop and feel better.  I had to give in and have another surgery 2 weeks ago and Now in trememdous pain, barely move my arm, and been vomiting.  HELP what else to do?This discussion is related to/posts/show/200447.
